standards.standard: Version must be of the form vX.Y where X is the major and Y is the minor release
Avoid exposing technical attributes or attributes that are not useful for common use cases
Where apis interact with cross platform objects - use the common name e.g. user, bundle, resource (not channel or stream) and common object definitions
Should only respond to supported operations
Must follow Client Server
Must be Stateless
Must be Layered System
Must follow HTTP spec
All names must be semantically precise w/o unnecessary qualifiers
Collection resource name must be plural
standards.Automated Checking Comments: Currently Checks the resource url for this standard

standards.standard: All names should be camel case w/o hyphen/underscore/number unless semantically meaningful
standards.Automated Checking Comments: Currently Checks the resource url for this standard

standards.standard: All names should be Initial lower case
Identifier field names should have Id suffix or be named as id
standards.Automated Checking Comments: There does not seem to be an indication of which property is the id - no Oracle meta property for example. Therefore we ask for the id in the checkers meta-data. We verify that this id is always present in any of the representation of the resource
standards.Further Automated Checking: This has not been implemented very robustly!

standards.standard: Nice to have: boolean field names end with Flag
Nice to have: fields that indicate a user end with 'By'
JSON must be supported
XML should be supported
Root resource URI must follow: /[context/]version/resourceName
Must be only one root URI per unique resource
URI of singular resource within a collection must follow: /[context/]version/resourceName/resourceId
Reference Sub resource URI must follow: /[context/]version/resourceName/accessorResourceName
Child Sub resource URI must follow:  /[context/]version/resourceName/childName
Resource representation should include the identifier attributes
Amount complex type should be used to represent amount value with a unit of measure.
Currency type should be used to represent money.
Singular must follow the base singular resource definition.
Collection resource must follow the base collection resource definition.
Self link should be included.
If self link is provided, rel must be 'self'.
Canonical link should be included.
If canonical link is provided, rel must be 'canonical'.
Links to children should be included.
Link to parent should be included.
If parent link is provided, rel should be 'parent'.
Link to related resources should be included.
Pagination should be provided for collection resource.
Pagination links may be either placed in the header, or in the response body. If it is in the header, then it must be located in the Link section of the HTTP header
Next link must be provided if pagination is enabled and there is a next page. rel must be 'next'.
Previous link must be provided if pagination is enabled and there is a previous page. rel must be 'prev'.
First link may be provided if pagination is enabled. If provided, rel must be 'first'.
Last link may be provided if pagination is enabled. If provided, rel must be 'last'.
If multiple versions are supported, then GET must be supported at /[context] to return a collection of versions, GET must be supported at /[context]/version to return representation for a version.
Response returned from GET /[context] must be valid against oracle collection resource schema
/[context]/version must return representation that is valid against oracle version resource schema
Metadata should be provided
If metadata is provided, then the metadata URI must be /[context/]version/metadata-catalog/resourceName
/[context/]version/metadata-catalog/resourceName must support GET and return resource name, link to resource, link to json schema, if media type is not provided, or as application/json
/[context/]version/metadata-catalog/resourceName must support GET and return json schema of the resource, if media type is application/schema+json
OPTIONS should be provided at /[context/]version/resourceName, with response header containing a link to json schema with rel=describedby
If metadata is provided, then GET should be supported at /[context/]version/metadata-catalog/, which is a collection resource of resource metadata.
If metadata is provided, a resource must be valid against its schema
Collection resource schema should extend Oracle base collection resource schema
Singular resource schema should extend Oracle base singular resource schema
It is optional to support expanding the child resource in the response.
If expanding child resources is supported, then 'expand' query parameter must be used to achieve that. The query parameter value must be comma separated child resource name
Optional to support dotted annotation for nested child in 'expand' query parameter.
Optional to support 'expand=all' to expand all child resources.
It is optional to support projection (restricting what fields to return).
If projection is supported, then 'fields' query parameter must be used to achieve that. The query parameter value must be comma separated child resource name.
Optional to support dot annotation for nested child in 'field' query parameter.
If pagination is supported, then 'limit' and 'offset' query parameters must be supported.
'limit' query parameter must be used to control how many rows to return.
'offset' query parameter must be used to control from which row the response contains.
If pagination is supported, then 'fromId' query parameter may be supported.
'fromId' query parameter must be used to retrieve items from specified ID.
If pagination is supported, then 'since' query parameter may be supported.
'since' query parameter must be used to retrieve items newer than specified timestamp.
If pagination is supported, then 'until' query parameter may be supported.
'until' query parameter must be used to retrieve items older than specified timestamp.
It is optional to support where clause when querying a collection resource.
If where clause is supported, then 'q' query parameter must be used to achieve that.
It is optional to support including the total row count in response. (Beyond what is in the current response.)
If count is supported, then 'totalResults' query parameter must be used to achieve that. Syntax: 'totalResults=true' or 'totalResults=false'. Default is false.
When totalResults=true is specified, response must contain 'totalResult' property. This property contains total number of rows.
Optional: support sorting in collection resource query.
If sorting is supported, then 'orderBy' query parameter must be used to achieve that. The query parameter value must be a comma separated tokens. Each token is fielddName[':'('asc'/'desc')].
Syntax for 'orderBy': optional to support dot annotation of the field name.
Optional to support restricting what links to return.
'links' query parameter must be used to restrict which links to return. The query parameter value must be a comma separated rel names.
Accept/Content-Type must be supported.
ETag must be supported.
Accept-Language/Content-Language must be supported.
Location must be supported.
If-Match and If-None-Match should be supported.
Must use response codes to indicate the result of HTTP request according to HTTP spec.
4xx must be used for problems that client can fix.
5xx must be used for problems that client cannot fix.
If additional error information is provided then, it must be included in the error response body and it must be valid against the exception detail complex type.
Basic Auth over SSL must be supported.
OAuth must be supported (when it is available).
When caching is supported, etag, If-Match, and If-None-Match must be used to achieve it.
Accept-Language and Content-Language must be used to specify the language requested/responded if content negotiation is supported.
Timezone sensitive Datetime values must use the ISO 8601 format: YYYYMMDDThh:mm:ss[.sss]Z
Timezone insensitive date values must use YYYYMMDD format.
For a timezone sensitive datetime value and the timezone varies object by object, then the value should be represented using the Object Specific Datetime Complex type.
If metadata is supported, and a resource supports content negotiation, then o:languageNegotiable must be used to describe that.
For a resource that supports content negotiation, it is optional to support langpref query parameter.
If a query parameter is used to specify preferred language for content negotiation, then langpref must be used.
For a resource that supports content negotiation, it is optional to support lang query parameter, which determines which lang must be used.
If a query parameter is used to dictate which language is used, then it must be 'lang'.
